thread.title: Teenager stabbed in the street in north Manchester - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Teenager stabbed in the street in north Manchester - Manchester Evening News

author: Sam Yarwood
title: Teenager stabbed in the street in north Manchester - Manchester Evening News
text:
Teenager stabbed in the street in north Manchester Police were called to Scotland Hall Road in Newton Heath at around 9.45pm on Friday night Share Scotland Hall Road in Newton Heath (Photo: Google) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Police are investigating after a teenager was stabbed in the street in Manchester. 
The 18-year-old was attacked on Scotland Hall Road in Newton Heath at around 9.45pm last night. 
It’s understood he was approached on the street by another man and the two got into an argument. 
The suspect then pulled out a knife and stabbed him in the back. 
The victim was discovered by ambulance crews and was taken to hospital with non-life threatening knife wounds and has since been discharged. 
Witnesses say the street was taped off as officers examined the scene. Read More GMP bosses apologise after blind man was tasered when his walking stick was mistaken for a gun 
A spokesman for GMP said: “We were called by the North West Ambulance Service at 9.45pm on Friday to Scotland Hall Road in Newton Heath to reports that an 18-year-old man had been stabbed. 
“He was taken to hospital with knife wounds to the back which are not believed to be life threatening. 
“The victim has since been discharged. 
“Enquiries are ongoing and we would urge anyone with any information to contact police on 101 or the independent charity Crimestoppers, anonymously, on 0800 555 111.” Like us on Facebook
